page.title: 04Urban & Rural Landscapes
page.content: Chertsey has a mixture of woods, fields, open and urban areas. The houses are of varied character, and includes small blocks of flats, old large detached houses, and maisonettes. The buildings in the town are of different ages because Chertsey has been settled for a long time. Some of the oldest buildings are the churches, several pubs, Abbey Barn and the old Town Hall. The shops along Guildford Street are varied, and change their functions regularly. Chertsey has several small estates for light and assembly industries, which use large warehouse-type buildings. The only "heavy" industry in the area is gravel extraction. The M25 and M3 just outside Chertsey have a visual impact on the scenery and have increased noise and pollution.
